intro: Parsonsia cyanea, commonly known as the blue parsnip, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are often visited by birds and insects. The fruit is a follicle that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in local habitats.
